data.event: One of the New Hampshire grants, the township was created on August 17, 1761, by a royal charter which King George III of the United Kingdom issued to Governor Benning Wentworth.
The town was first settled about 1765 by Robert Havens and family.

event.title: 1780 during the Revolution, the village was attacked

data.event: In 1780 during the Revolution, the village was attacked in the Royalton Raid, when a combined force of British soldiers and Indians burned houses and killed livestock.

event.title: June 26, 1848, the Vermont Central Railroad opened

data.event: On June 26, 1848, the Vermont Central Railroad opened from White River Junction to Bethel, traversing Sharon and accelerating its development.
By 1859, when the population reached 1,240, Sharon had 12 sawmills, a gristmill, and a bobbin factory.
